g.text: Findings from Cognitive Science => Reflexive Pedagogy
Learners relate new ideas and concepts to previous
Learners integrate their knowledge into interrelated
Learners look for patterns and underlying principles
Learners treat course material as unrelated to what
Learners treat course material as disconnected bits
Learners memorize facts and carry out procedures
Learners understand the process of dialogue through which
knowledge is created, and they examine the logic of an
Learners are the also knowledge producers, and discerning
: learners interact with new forms of media; they
consume and produce multimodal knowledge artefacts
Learners treat facts and procedures as static
knowledge, handed down from an all
Learner is the knowledge consumer, with passive
Learners reflect on their own understanding, and their own
Learners memorize without reflecting on the
purpose, or on their own learning strategies.
Focus on facts to be remembered, theories to be
